channel.title: Dan Carlin's Hardcore History
channel.description: Was Alexander the Great as bad a person as Hitler? What was the greatest army of all time? Which U.S. President was the worst? Hardcore History discusses the issues and questions history fans love.
channel.itunes:summary: In "Hardcore History" the very unconventional Dan Carlin takes his "Martian", outside-the-box way of thinking and applies it to the past. Was Alexander the Great as bad a person as Adolf Hitler? What would Apaches with modern weapons be like? Will our modern civilization ever fall like civilizations from past eras? This is a difficult-to-classify show that has a rather sharp edge. It's not for everyone. But the innovative style and approach has made "Dan Carlin's Hardcore History" a New Media hit.
channel.itunes:subtitle: Was Alexander the Great as bad a person as Hitler? What was the greatest army of all time? Which U.S. President was the worst? Hardcore History discusses the issues and questions history fans love.
channel.itunes:author: Dan Carlin
channel.itunes:keywords: History, Military, War, Ancient, Archaeology, Classics, Carlin

item.title: Hardcore History 39 - Death Throes of the Republic VI
item.description: In a massive finish to the "Dan Carlin version" of the fall of the Roman Republic, conspiracies, civil wars, beatniks of antiquity and a guy named Caesar figure prominently. Virtually everyone dies.
item.itunes:subtitle: In a massive finish to the "Dan Carlin version" of the fall of the Roman Republic, conspiracies, civil wars, beatniks of antiquity and a guy named Caesar figure prominently. Virtually everyone dies.
item.itunes:summary: In a massive finish to the "Dan Carlin version" of the fall of the Roman Republic, conspiracies, civil wars, beatniks of antiquity and a guy named Caesar figure prominently. Virtually everyone dies.
item.itunes:keywords: Rome, Marius, Sulla, Greece, war, military, legion, ancient, history, podcast, constitution, senate, revolution, Civil, Caesar, republic, dictator, violence, political, Pompey, Crassus, Cicero, Cato, Catiline, revolt, pirates

item.title: Hardcore History 38 - Death Throes of the Republic V
item.description: The last great generation of the Roman Republic emerges from the historical mists. The dynamic between Caesar, Cato, Cicero, Crassus and Pompey forms the axis around which the rest of this tale revolves.
item.itunes:subtitle: The last great generation of the Roman Republic emerges from the historical mists. The dynamic between Caesar, Cato, Cicero, Crassus and Pompey forms the axis around which the rest of this tale revolves.
item.itunes:summary: The last great generation of the Roman Republic emerges from the historical mists. The dynamic between Caesar, Cato, Cicero, Crassus and Pompey forms the axis around which the rest of this tale revolves.
item.itunes:keywords: Rome, Marius, Sulla, war, military, legion, ancient, history, podcast, senate, revolution, Civil, Caesar, republic, dictator, violence, political, Pompey, Crassus, Cicero, Cato, Catiline, Spartacus, slave, revolt, pirates, crucifixion

item.title: Hardcore History 37 - Death Throes of the Republic IV
item.description: Sulla returns to Rome to show the Republic what REAL political violence looks like. Civil war and deadly partisan payback will pave the way for reforms pushed at sword point. Lots of heads will roll...literally.
item.itunes:subtitle: Sulla returns to Rome to show the Republic what REAL political violence looks like. Civil war and deadly partisan payback will pave the way for reforms pushed at sword point. Lots of heads will roll...literally.
item.itunes:summary: Sulla returns to Rome to show the Republic what REAL political violence looks like. Civil war and deadly partisan payback will pave the way for reforms pushed at sword point. Lots of heads will roll...literally.

item.title: Hardcore History 36 - Death Throes of the Republic III
item.description: Rome's political violence expands in intensity from riots and assassinations to outright war as the hyper-ambitious generals Marius and Sulla tear the Republic and its constitution apart vying for power and glory.
item.itunes:subtitle: Rome's political violence expands in intensity from riots and assassinations to outright war as the hyper-ambitious generals Marius and Sulla tear the Republic and its constitution apart vying for power and glory.
item.itunes:summary: Rome's political violence expands in intensity from riots and assassinations to outright war as the hyper-ambitious generals Marius and Sulla tear the Republic and its constitution apart vying for power and glory.

item.title: Hardcore History 35 - Death Throes of the Republic II
item.description: Disaster threatens the Republic, but the cure might be worse than the disease. "The Dan Carlin version" of this story continues with ambition-addict Marius dominating the story and Plutarch dominating the sources.
item.itunes:subtitle: Disaster threatens the Republic, but the cure might be worse than the disease. "The Dan Carlin version" of this story continues with ambition-addict Marius dominating the story and Plutarch dominating the sources.
item.itunes:summary: Disaster threatens the Republic, but the cure might be worse than the disease. "The Dan Carlin version" of this story continues with ambition-addict Marius dominating the story and Plutarch dominating the sources.

item.title: Hardcore History 34 - Death Throes of the Republic I
item.description: The wars which elevate Rome to superpower status also sow the seed for the downfall of its political system. Money, slaves, ambition, political stalemate and class warfare prove to be a toxic, bloody mix.
item.itunes:subtitle: The wars which elevate Rome to superpower status also sow the seed for the downfall of its political system. Money, slaves, ambition, political stalemate and class warfare prove to be a toxic, bloody mix.
item.itunes:summary: The wars which elevate Rome to superpower status also sow the seed for the downfall of its political system. Money, slaves, ambition, political stalemate and class warfare prove to be a toxic, bloody mix.
item.itunes:keywords: podcast, Rome, Republican, General, army, politics, MacArthur, Truman, Caesar, Gracchus, revolution, social, slaves, patrician, senate, ancient, history, constitution, class, warfare

item.title: Hardcore History 33 - (BLITZ) Old School Toughness
item.description: Does the toughness of peoples play any role in history? How can historians deal with such an amorphous human quality? Historiography, boxing, barbarians, philosophy and wisdom are among the subjects touched upon.
item.itunes:subtitle: Does the toughness of peoples play any role in history? How can historians deal with such an amorphous human quality? Historiography, boxing, barbarians, philosophy and wisdom are among the subjects touched upon.

item.title: Hardcore History 32 - Globalization Unto Death
item.description: Ferdinand Magellan is the lead character in this episode about the collision between the Old and New worlds and what Dan calls "Globalization 1.0". It is also full of controversy!

item.title: Hardcore History 31 - (BLITZ) Suffer the Children
item.description: Dan's exposure to the idea of "psychohistory" gets him thinking about how children were raised in the past. Could widespread child abuse and bad parenting in earlier eras explain some of history's brutality?
item.itunes:subtitle: Dan's exposure to the idea of "psychohistory" gets him thinking about how children were raised in the past. Could widespread child abuse and bad parenting in earlier eras explain some of history's brutality?

item.description: In the final episode of the horror story that is the Eastern Front the tale descends into unimaginable darkness as vengeance is called down on Germany. This graphic episode is not for young ears.

item.title: Hardcore History 26 - (BLITZ) Addicted to Bondage
item.description: Is slavery a natural feature of human societies? Dan looks at this timeless, evil institution and wonders if we have made as much progress freeing ourselves from its influence as we think we have.

item.title: Hardcore History 23 - Punic Nightmares III
item.description: In one of the great displays of resiliency in all history, the Romans refuse to buckle under murderous Carthaginian pressure. Instead they recover, defeat and destroy Carthage, and conquer most of the Mediterranean.

item.title: Hardcore History 19 - Apache Tears
item.description: A traumatized people who traumatized their neighbors, the Native American tribe known as Apache were among the last Indians to surrender to the U.S. Government. Dan, of course, has thoughts. This is a long show!

item.title: Hardcore History 17 - Judgment at Nineveh
item.description: Will our modern society ever decline and fall? Dan uses that idea as a backdrop for a look at the first great empire in history, the biblical-era Assyrians. Were they ancient Nazis, or the guardians of civilization?

item.title: Hardcore History 5 - Meandering Through The Cold War
item.description: Dan meanders through a conversation about causes and effects of the Cold War without ever talking much about the actual events of the conflict.
item.itunes:subtitle: Dan meanders through a conversation about causes and effects of the Cold War without ever talking much about the actual events of the conflict.
item.itunes:summary: Dan meanders through a conversation about causes and effects of the Cold War without ever talking much about the actual events of the conflict.
item.itunes:keywords: cold, war, Soviet, U.S.S.R.,Cuba, communism, missile,nuclear,history, podcast, Carlin

item.title: Hardcore History 4 - Romancing The Tribes
item.description: Native American chief Tecumseh and Gallic king Vercingetorix both tried to unify their tribal peoples to face overwhelming foes. Dan examines the romance of their lost causes.
item.itunes:subtitle: Native American chief Tecumseh and Gallic king Vercingetorix both tried to unify their tribal peoples to face overwhelming foes. Dan examines the romance of their lost causes.
item.itunes:summary: Native American chief Tecumseh and Gallic king Vercingetorix both tried to unify their tribal peoples to face overwhelming foes. Dan examines the romance of their lost causes.
item.itunes:keywords: Tecumseh, Vercingetorix, Gaul, Celtic, Indian, Native, tribal, Romans, podcast, history, war

item.title: Hardcore History 3 - The Organization of Peace
item.description: The early 20th century League of Nations stood for peace, cooperation, disarmament and international understanding. What happened?
item.itunes:subtitle: The early 20th century League of Nations stood for peace, cooperation, disarmament and international understanding. What happened?
item.itunes:summary: The early 20th century League of Nations stood for peace, cooperation, disarmament and international understanding. What happened?
item.itunes:keywords: league, nations, diplomacy, history, war, appeasement, Wilson, security, global

item.title: Hardcore History 2 - Guns & Horses
item.description: The West is Mike Tyson and the East is Muhammad Ali in this episode as Dan mixes Art Bell, with Hans Delbruck in this look at a possible reason for the military decline of the near East.
item.itunes:keywords: history, firearms, guns, cavalry, military, warfare

item.title: Hardcore History 1 - Alexander versus Hitler
item.description: Dan compares the way the modern world sees Adolf Hitler with the way history views Alexander the Great and wonders if the two men weren't more alike than different.
item.itunes:subtitle: Dan compares the way the modern world sees Adolf Hitler with the way history views Alexander the Great and wonders if the two men weren't more alike than different.
item.itunes:summary: Dan compares the way the modern world sees Adolf Hitler with the way history views Alexander the Great and wonders if the two men weren't more alike than different.
item.itunes:keywords: Alexander, Hitler, genocide, ethnic, history, war, military
